availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James S. Whitaker (Shelby County, Kentucky, clerk.)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, clerk, notary public, and police judge. Kentucky native. Married to Phoebe Helena Chiles Whitaker in Shelby County, Kentucky, on July 1, 1822. Father of B.T. Whitaker, Walter C. Whitaker, and Elizabeth E. Whitaker. Served in the 9th Regiment of the Kentucky Mounted Volunteers as a captain during the War of 1812. Clerk of the County Court in Shelby County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1850. Police judge in Shelby County in 1860. Owned fifteen enslaved persons in Shelby County in 1860. Notary public in Shelby County in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film 000259283.
